intro: Amsinckia menziesii var. menziesii, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and has a taproot system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Its flowers bloom in the spring and are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies.
